easy.notes: Easy groups: 1) items with wheels (concrete objects). 2) things you stomp on (fruits with different sizes). 3) colors commonly seen in the sky (simple color words). 4) everyday school supplies. Near-miss temptation: 'book' might seem like a school thing, but it's not a direct supply item in the group; it’s excluded to keep four clear items per group.

medium.notes: Medium groups: 1) Prefixes that form new words when attached to root (un-, re-, pre-, dis-). Near-miss: 'together' could seem related to 'connected', but does not fit the prefix pattern. 2) Flying-related items including a simple paper craft; 3) Opposites in daily feelings; 4) Basic geometric shapes; avoid including any item that would strongly overlap with another group (e.g., 'round' vs 'circle' is avoided by keeping explicit shape names).

hard.notes: Hard groups: 1) Time-related words that link through concept of time; avoid using 'now' or 'present' to prevent overlap with other items. 2) Multi-use tools: each item has at least two clear functions. 3) Nature helpers: elements that enable growth or weather; 4) Simple instruments that produce sound; near-miss temptation: 'whistle' could be considered a sound-maker but is not included since it’s not a stand-alone instrument here; keep four clear instrument items.
